name: More Movies from the 80s Multiple Choice Quiz | Movies by Year | 20 Questions

questions.text: Which movie is this quote from: "Fellas, last year I made three million dollars, but your fifty thousand was the most fun."?
questions.explanation:
Dirty Rotten Scoundrels.

	A hilarious film starring Michael Caine and Steve Martin as crooks working their way through the rich women of the French Riviera. This line comes from Janet, played by Glenne Headly, who managed to out-con the con artists!

questions.text: Which movie contains the line, "Gotta get my boxer shorts at K-Mart."?
questions.explanation:
Rain Man.

	This film won the Oscar for Best Picture. Dustin Hoffman also took home a statue for his role as Raymond, and Barry Levinson received the award for Best Director. This line is said by Raymond, Hoffman's character, during an argument about which store he and his brother, Charlie should visit in order to buy underwear.

questions.text: In which film does someone stats, "We're going to die, and I'm wearing my mother's underwear."?
questions.explanation:
Grease 2.

	A film that is probably most famous for being an unfortunate blip in the career of Michelle Pfeiffer! It also starred Lorna Luft, who is the half sister of Liza Minnelli, and the daughter of Judy Garland. This line is spoken by Sharon, played by Maureen Teefy, (who also starred in "Supergirl"). It is spoken during a car chase scene, in which the Pink Ladies are trying to save Stephanie's (Pfeiffer's) mystery man, played by Maxwell Caulfield.

questions.text: Which movie is this quote from, "I'm on a pilgrimage to see a moose."?
questions.explanation:
National Lampoon's Vacation.

	The first in a series of films about the Griswald family, headed up by dad, Clark. This quote, from Clark, played by Chevy Chase, refers to their trip across country to go to Wally World, which ultimately ends in disaster as they realise the theme park is closed.

questions.text: In what film does someone callously declare, "If he dies, he dies."?
questions.explanation:
Rocky IV.

	This line is delivered by Dolph Lundgren, playing Drago. In this scene, he has just killed Apollo Creed in the ring.

questions.text: "Men, can't live with them, can't shoot them," is a quote from which film?
questions.explanation:
St. Elmo's Fire

	A great film directed by Joel Schumacher. This line comes from Leslie, played by Ally Sheedy. She had just found out that her fiance had been cheating on her, and one of her best friends was secretly in love with her.

questions.text: In which film is someone told, "That's the Chicago way."?
questions.explanation:
The Untouchables.

	"They pull a knife, you pull a gun. He sends one of yours to the hospital, you send one of his to the morgue. That's the Chicago way, and that's how you get Capone." This quote comes from Sean Connery's character, Malone, as he is giving Ness, played by Kevin Coster, a motivational speech. One of my favourite lines and films from the 1980s!

questions.text: "Oh, but baby fish mouth is sweeping the nation," is a line from which romantic comedy?
questions.explanation:
When Harry Met Sally.

	This line follows a rather heated round of Pictionary. This line is spoken by Harry, played by Billy Crystal, as Jess, played by Bruno Kirby, refuses to believe that "Baby Talk" is a saying!

questions.text: Which movie contains the line, "You know if it wasn't for this man, I'd be standing here dead."?
questions.explanation:
Dirty Dancing.

	The fabulously kitsch film that rocketed Patrick Swayze to stardom! This quote comes from Max Kellerman, played by Jack Weston, as he tells the Houseman daughters how their father saved his life.

questions.text: In which action-comedy does someone ask, "Where does he get those wonderful toys?"?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	A line from The Joker, played memorably by Jack Nicholson, as he admires the Bat Utility Belt!

questions.text: Name the film in which Kerry Coughlin is played by Kelly Lynch.
questions.explanation:
Cocktail.

	Kerry is the unfaithful wife of Doug, Brian's mentor. "Cocktail" also featured an early appearance from Gina Gershon, who played Coral.

questions.text: Darryl Jenks is a character played by Eriq La Salle in which film?
questions.explanation:
Coming to America.

	Darryl Jenks is the man who stands to inherit the "Soul Glo" empire. By the looks of things, he uses more than his fair share of the product!

questions.text: In which film is Omar Suarez played by F. Murray Abraham?
questions.explanation:
Scarface.

	Brian De Palma's version of "Scarface" had an all-star cast, including Al Pacino and Michelle Pfeiffer. Suarez is a drug baron involved in deals with Pacino's, Tony Montana.

questions.text: Sarah Tobias, played by Jodie Foster appears in which film?
questions.explanation:
The Accused.

	Also starring Kelly McGillis, this film told the true story of a woman's fight for justice following a rape.

questions.text: The character, MacMillan played by Robert Loggia, is in which movie?
questions.explanation:
Big.

	This film starred Tom Hanks as Josh, the boy who wished he was big, only to regret doing so later. MacMillan is the head of a toy company who promotes Josh. This film gave Hanks his first Oscar nomination.

questions.text: Which movie contains Madame de Volanges played by Swoozie Kurtz?
questions.explanation:
Dangerous Liaisons.

	Swoozie Kurtz also had a part as a therapist, in "Cruel Intentions", a 1990s update on "Dangerous Liaisons".

questions.text: Roberta Glass, played by Rosanna Arquette appears in which movie?
questions.explanation:
Desperately Seeking Susan.

	Roberta Glass was a woman obsessed with Susan and Jim, a couple who communicated through the personals. On a trip to meet them, she suffers a bang to the head, and wakes up believing she is Susan.

questions.text: Dale Biberman played by Andie McDowell, appears in which movie?
questions.explanation:
St. Elmo's Fire

	Kirby, played by Emilio Estevez, is obsessed with Dale, who he dated once in college. It would seem that his humiliation has no limits, as he embarks on a quest to win her affections!

questions.text: In what movie would you see Ophelia played by Jamie Lee Curtis?
questions.explanation:
Trading Places.

	Ophelia is a prostitute who takes a newly-poor Louis, played by Dan Ackroyd, under her wing, after she meets him in jail.

questions.text: Ed Rooney played by Jeffrey Jones, appears in which movie?
questions.explanation:
Ferris Bueller's Day Off.

	Ed Rooney is the school principal, who spends the movie trying to catch Ferris skipping school. Hope you enjoyed the quiz!
